quotes.author: David Wheeler
quotes.quote: All problems in computer science can be solved by another level of indirection.
quotes.meaning: Software complexity is often managed by introducing layers of abstraction.

quotes.author: David Wheeler
quotes.quote: Compatibility means deliberately repeating other people's mistakes.
quotes.meaning: Backward compatibility often forces us to preserve old design flaws.

quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.quote: Science is a self-correcting process. To be accepted, new ideas must survive the most rigorous standards of evidence and scrutiny.
quotes.meaning: Science progresses by subjecting hypotheses to falsification and peer review.

quotes.author: Carl Sagan
quotes.quote: Science is founded on uncertainty. Each time we learn something new and surprising, the astonishment comes with the realization that we were wrong before.
quotes.meaning: Discovery often overturns prior beliefs; humility toward knowledge is fundamental.

quotes.author: Charles Darwin
quotes.quote: It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent. It is the one most responsive to change.
quotes.meaning: Adaptability—not raw strength or intellect—often determines survival.

quotes.author: Marie Curie
quotes.quote: Nothing in life is to be feared. It is only to be understood.
quotes.meaning: Knowledge and inquiry dispel fear of the unknown.

quotes.author: René Descartes
quotes.quote: I think, therefore I am.
quotes.meaning: Self-awareness affirms existence even amid doubt.

quotes.author: William James
quotes.quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
quotes.meaning: Authentic thought requires critical reflection, not just reshuffling existing beliefs.

quotes.author: Plutarch
quotes.quote: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
quotes.meaning: Education should ignite curiosity rather than merely passively transfer information.

quotes.author: Socrates
quotes.quote: I know that I know nothing.
quotes.meaning: True wisdom begins with recognizing the limits of one’s knowledge.

quotes.author: Sun Tzu
quotes.quote: The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting.
quotes.meaning: The best victory is one won through strategy, not sheer force.

quotes.author: Lao Tzu
quotes.quote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
quotes.meaning: Both love received and love given shape our moral and spiritual fiber.

quotes.author: Alan Watts
quotes.quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
quotes.meaning: Resistance to change breeds confusion; harmony requires flow with life's currents.

quotes.author: Immanuel Kant
quotes.quote: Experience without theory is blind, but theory without experience is mere intellectual play.
quotes.meaning: Knowledge requires both empirical grounding and conceptual structure.

quotes.author: Bertrand Russell
quotes.quote: The whole problem with the world is that fools and fanatics are always so certain of themselves, and wiser people so full of doubts.
quotes.meaning: Intellectual humility is rarer than dogmatic certainty.

quotes.author: Hypatia
quotes.quote: Reserve your right to think, for even to think wrongly is better than not to think at all.
quotes.meaning: Independent thought, even if error-prone, is essential to intellectual integrity.

quotes.author: Francis Bacon
quotes.quote: Knowledge is power.
quotes.meaning: Understanding the world grants capacity to act and transform it.

quotes.author: Niels Bohr
quotes.quote: The opposite of a right statement is a wrong statement. The opposite of a deep truth can also be a deep truth.
quotes.meaning: Profound truths may coexist with their seeming contradictions.

quotes.author: Ernest Rutherford
quotes.quote: If you don't do the best with what you have, you could never have done better with what you could have had.
quotes.meaning: Make full use of your current resources—there’s no virtue in wasted potential.

quotes.author: Isidor Rabi
quotes.quote: Great scientists usually show up when and where in the history of science they are needed.
quotes.meaning: Scientific breakthroughs often emerge in response to the demands of their time.
